result.execSummary:
The defendant William Morrison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for 1 DAY time served. Huber privileges to apply for work.
Contact the Probation Office by 5:00pm on 9/30/2022.

miscConds.notes:
-Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
-Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on 10/4/2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
-Any cash bond on deposit to be applied.
-No possession of any firearms unless part of the firearms safety course.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Morrison

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William Morrison in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for William Morrison.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 2 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 DAY time served. Huber privileges to apply for work. Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 9 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Contact the Probation Office by 5:00pm on 9/30/2022.  
-Complete 10 hours of community service.
-Complete a firearm safety course.
-No possession of any firearms unless part of the firearms safety course.
-Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
-Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on 10/4/2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
-Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 
-APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.

Defendant William Morrison in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant William Morrison in court.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/19/22 @ 1p
